definition: to send to multiple recipients/mass mailout/to occur in a clustered fashion
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Group messaging is also going to be vastly improved.
sentences.chinese: 群发短信功能也将大加改善。

sentences.english: textPlus, a mobile app, offers users free texting with group text capability.
sentences.chinese: 一项手机应用，提供给用户免费的群发短信功能。

sentences.english: Mass text messages were used to urge residents within the capital to rise up.
sentences.chinese: 他们用大批群发短信动员居民起义。

sentences.english: It also offers group text messaging and video chat.
sentences.chinese: 它还具备消息群发和多人视频聊天的功能。

sentences.english: Objective To study the characteristics of patients with acute arsine poisoning and its possible treatments.
sentences.chinese: 目的探究群发性急性砷化氢中毒的临床特点及治疗。

definition: to transmit/to dispatch/to issue (an official document or credential)
money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
Moments (social networking function of smartphone app WeChat 微信[Wei1 xin4])
Weixin or WeChat (mobile text and voice messaging service developed by Tencent 騰訊|腾讯[Teng2 xun4])
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to add sb to one's blacklist (on a cellphone, or in instant messaging software etc)/abbr. for 拉到黑名單|拉到黑名单
verification code/CAPTCHA, a type of challenge-response test (computing)
to reissue/(of a disease) to recur/(of a patient) to suffer a relapse
to screen/to block (sth or sb)/to shield/(protective) shield
